intro: Tetradium daniellii, commonly known as the Chinese tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers followed by orange to red berries. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been introduced to other parts of the world, sometimes becoming invasive. The tree is also valued for its hard, durable wood.
